Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: nicole s
Reviews.Content: I am completely pissed about our hotel experience! First we were sent to our room and it wasn't cleaned yet. Had to wait an hour in the lobby before it was ready. And when we got in there, there was stuff all over the floor and just not as clean as i would have expected. Next, the air conditioning did not work. I know its March, but it was 84 outside and even though it looks like you have your own temp controls, you dont. Also, our toliet didn't flush! When we called down to tell them the phone was not plugged into the jack. Low and behold there was a reason why...the phone wouldnt stop ringing! So we had a 85 degree room, no phone and no toliet!!!!!!!!! Went down on our way out to dinner to let them know, they said it would be fixed by the time we got back (the phone and toliet). They NEVER came and fixed it. One night at 179.99 plus tax wasn't worth it. We will NEVER come back here and we will NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and dirty”
Reviews.Author: CindyR49441
Reviews.Content: Ruined, what would have been a really fun weekend. We booked 2 Superior king suites. It was unseasonably warm for St. Patrick's day weekend, but unfortunately, there is NO "climate control", as the Internet stated.Our room ranged from 80-85 degrees and all of the windows are sealed shut. Multiple complaints got us nowhere because the entire hotel temperature can only be " switched" seasonally. Even though they were completely booked, they would not do the " switch". Next, our room was filthy. There was debris in several corners that were not vacuumed. Upon removal of the cushions to the sofa sleeper, a bunch of crumbs, debris & cellophane wrappers were found & we chose NOT to sleep on it. A supervisor insinuated that we, might have dirtied it. Even though this hotel is inexpensive, the minimum I expect, is cleanliness!!! The ONLY thing, this hotel, can offer, is good location. We checked out a day early & went a couple miles away to a very clean Holiday Inn that has air conditioning and heat control for each individual room, as all hotel rooms should have, in this day & age.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money saved.”
Reviews.Author: Diane W
Reviews.Content: We were in the city for a bachelorette party and St. Patty's Day. Upon checking in and seeing how TINY the room was, we opted for an upgrade to a king suite because 4 people could hardly even move in the standard room. After being first sent to the wrong room, then sitting on hold with the front desk for 10 minutes, we finally got the correct room. Then on the second night we found a huge cockroach crawling up the wall. When we took it to the front desk, the manager told us that this is 'normal' and that it's because we are in the city. He tried to tell us that all of the hotels in the area actually have cockroaches. (after seeing a room at the Wyndham down the street, I highly doubt that is true) We didn't even want to stay after finding the cockroach but since it was St. Patty's Day, all of the hotels in the area were sold out. The manager did comp us for one night, even though we wanted him to get us a room in a different hotel. I'll never go back to this hotel again and I'm hoping we didn't bring any cockroaches home with us.

Reviews.Title: “Could be fine, but wasn't during my visit.”
Reviews.Author: BlondeValor
Reviews.Content: I took a week to give thought to my review here - the hotel is obviously in the middle of an upgrade and that didn't bother me whatsoever. I'm a penny pincher, and I SO wanted to give this hotel my vote of confindence. BUT, I've told myself next visit to Chicago I'm not going to be so cheap. First if you are on a budget, there is nothing here that should preclude you from staying here, you can't beat the location or the price. The staff was as helpful as they could be - Kelly did everything she could - but unfortunately we had three issues during our stay, all of which could occur anywhere, but it just seems too much for one trip. First the remote control to the TV did not control our TV, after I went down to the desk several times and five remotes later it still didn't work and I couldn't change the channels manually either, so we had a choice of ESPN or nothing - not so great with two kids (they did comp. our rate for that night for this). Second, the toilet overflowed... Kelly was the only one on duty and there was no maintenance people on-site at this 10 PM time so it took over an hour to get a plunger and fresh towels to "solve" the issue. Both of these items were resolved the next day while we were out and about, but upon returning the second day after having walked all over the city alas our keys didn't work to let us back in the room... SO, back down the SLOW elevator to get the keys reworked... Again, they fixed it ASAP so they really do try... I just think I'll shell out a little bit more for a better chance at a nice relaxing stay next time!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location... and Price”
Reviews.Author: candebat
Reviews.Content: I hesitate writing this review because if this place becomes popular, I'll loose the only sub $100/night hotel on the Magnificent Mile. Do not expect luxary... it is the equivalent of a decent motel outside the city. We only used the room for sleep and found it clean and comfortable. Pros: LOCATION, flat screen TV, free WiFi, clean room, friendly service, PRICE Cons: parking can add a hefty amount per day (but hey, it's center Chicago)

Reviews.Title: “Low price, regular service.”
Reviews.Author: lucaslbrandao
Reviews.Content: Best localization for the price. The hotel is a little old and there is only two elevators for whole hotel. I usually wait too long to go downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property in the past - and found it very convenient and very comfortable. The price is great too! This time, I found it rennovated and with an invigorated and can-do staff team in place! They are rennovating all of the guest rooms and my sense is that it will be even better! I would recommend this as a great place to stay at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “this place was great”
Reviews.Author: jon j
Reviews.Content: awesome place to stay if you are on a budget. my wife and i stayed here and could not be more satisfied with the staff and location. it is close to many things in chicago nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Economic one in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Yu H
Reviews.Content: Just ok. Free wifi and regular cleaning, but no breakfast. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal”
Reviews.Author: CollegeMom61
Reviews.Content: If you want convenience to Michigan Avenue and a great cost, this is the hotel for you. The desk staff was always friendly. They upgraded us to a larger room for free. the standard rooms are SMALL! But if you are on Michigan Avenue, you should be out in the stores and restaurants not your room! Overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “room upgrade with no extra price”
Reviews.Author: jaffetdz
Reviews.Content: great hotel, kinda old but with the Chitown feeling, the location of the hotel is perfect, just in the middle of the action at downtown. Real chep for the area around the corner from marshalls, the apple store, disney and all the great stores. i got really late that night of the resarvation i made but with no problem thay have my room and the upgraded to a deluxe suite with no estra charge so i had i great view from the city. at the front desk Michael always gave me a great service and helped me and my family with all the doubts we have of the city.

Reviews.Title: “efficient stay for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: healthEtreament
Reviews.Content: I'll say this much, the price was right. If i had paid more for the room, I don't think I'd give it an 'average' review. the hotel wasn't great, but for the price it's hard to complain

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: rebe_9
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews for this establishment, I was prepared for the worst. Check in was cold and slow. The front desk is right by the door, so your stuck waiting in the cold. Even the desk clerks have to wear winter coats with scarfs. The front desk clerks were more than nice. Parking is not included, but our friend that took us to the city was able to get free parking right in front of the hotel.(appears to be free over the weekend only) Our room was on the 7th floor, room 705. Fabulous view and not such a bad room either. The room came with a fridge and microwave, nice flat screen tv, coffee pot and blow dryer. The room appeared to be newly decorated. The bathroom had not been updated and was pretty small, but we were never in our room, so it didn't matter much. We didn't have maid service, we just got a few extra coffee cups from the maid Maria(who was very sweet) The hotel itself needs updating and general maintenance, but I can't complain. I didn't have any bugs in my room, no bed bugs, bed sheets were clean. What more could I ask for. The location is the best!! Right accross the street was a Dunkin Donuts and 7 Eleven, so very convenient for us to get our beer, water and cheap breakfast. We went to several bars. Two of our favorites were Howl at the Moon-dual piano bar(there is a cover charge) but if you check with the hotel, they may have discount coupons available. We also checked out Blue Chicago(great blues bar) there was a $10.00 cover charge, but it was well worth it, especially when the beers were only $4.00 compared to $7.00 at the Piano bar. Everything we did was in walking distance, although it got real cold Saturday, so we took the $6.00 cab ride back to the hotel. Overall, we had a great time at the Red Roof Inn. I would stay again and would recomend the hotel to others. Its nothing special, but for the money. It was worth it for us.

Reviews.Title: “YOU GET LIL'BIT MORE WHAT YOU GIVE”
Reviews.Author: s0ft_1
Reviews.Content: this hotel is the right place in chicago. Is near from everything, near from the michigan avenue(magnificent mille) just 1 block apart... the room is excellent: the bed was comfortable and big, the bathroom was OK (you don't need more), the room was clean, you gonna have everything you need from a hotel room that you only be inside to sleep or take a rest... I recommend 100% this place 'cause is cheap, is comfortable, is clean, the staff is gently and the best is that you are near from everything!! my boyfriend and I suddenly come back to the room to leave the shopping and then continue to the trip... in the front desk you can ask for a map of chicago. donÂ´t forget buy some popcorn gallons from the Garret popcorn store which is in front of the hotel :D is not a elegant o glamorous hotel, but is the right hotel to go to know chicago without spend lots of money.

Reviews.Title: “avoid avoid”
Reviews.Author: luperduper
Reviews.Content: do not go here ever. its dirty, grotty, the staff are awful.. its not a hotel its a grotty bedsit with an elevator.. it was our second and last time staying.just because it is just off michigan ave do not be fooled into thinking its ok to stay here. keep well clear. we checked out and went elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “very adequate_acceptable, magnificent location”
Reviews.Author: landskysea
Reviews.Content: all you want and desire to do in chicago start from this hotel _most of the attraction can reached by foot from the hotel_the reception give you a very useful map when you check in >that's really great_the lay in the heart of downtown_ john hancock is 2 blocks behind_navy pier ,lake shore,windella boat,shops is very close,hotel itself is clean _room is not small neither big average i can say_they have a concierge which kept my luggage until evening coz my flight was in midnight,anyhow i recommended to everyone _don't need to pay much more_chicago is beautiful city. enjoy

Reviews.Title: “No. Just No.”
Reviews.Author: electricboots
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positives. It's cheap and in a good location to nearby shopping, bars, etc. Other than that, I did not enjoy my stay here. First, We waited about ten minutes alone at the front desk before an employee finally showed up to check us in, and when she finally showed up, no apology, and was not friendly.. at all - not off to a good start. We get to our room and are greeted by an overwhelming smokey smell, a toilet that constantly runs, a bathroom door that you literally have to shove to even get open, and an a/c unit that sounds more like a motor boat. (which we ran all night to drown out the yelling in the hallways). I had a headache whenever I was in the room due to the smell and I asked to get non-smoking but was told no other rooms are available. To top it off though, every night that we stayed here, between 3 and 4am, we were woken up by the most loud obnoxious drunk people I have ever heard. Cops were called twice that I know of on them, because I heard them in the hallway. The walls are extremely thin. Because it consistently happened at the same time, we just decided to assume they are drunk ghosts. I'm never one to complain but our time here was so miserable, and things just got from bad to terrible - I have never experienced anything like it. I would not recommend this hotel and I will never stay at a Red Roof again.

Reviews.Title: “Well, we did have reservations but.....”
Reviews.Author: nikkic23
Reviews.Content: Looking at the reviews we were a bit apprehensive. We went with our gut feeling and canceled them. We found another hotel exactly one block away the wasn't much different in price. I sure am glad we did too! Out of curiosity, my friend and I walked down just to see what it looked like first hand. Dingy walls, unswept floors, elevators were very small and even saw dried blood on it's floor. Hallways extremely narrow. We don't spend a lot of time in the rooms when visiting Chicago, but we expect cleanliness anywhere we are laying our heads... Period.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: trailride4fun
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the only two good comments I have . . . the staff was very pleasant and the location is great. Now for the rest of the story . . . the small darm room was not clean. The mattress was completely worn out, you could feel every spring it had. The bathroom had stains all around the bottom of toliet and vanity, my guess is from a water leak. The bath tub needed to be replaced and the water pressure was terrible. No shampoo or conditioner. The carpet had not been vacuumed around the edges in years. Will not ever make reservations or stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap at its best”
Reviews.Author: Anna M
Reviews.Content: This isn't the ritz, but the Red Roof Inn is perfectly adequate cheap accomodation. The bed as very confortable. The room was clean enough. The air conditioning worked. The TV worked. The staff were friendly and helpful (though not great at understanding the kiwi accent). We stayed at two different Red Roofs for 4 nights in total. Red Roof has pared back to the essentials and done a good job of the things that matter. For $60-80 per night you will be satisfied. Choosing a chain brand motel is a good idea in America because they are looking for repeat customers, therein the base line is higher than other cheap motels who don't expect to see you again.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise for a budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KVM55
Reviews.Content: The question is: what do you want in a budget hotel? Friendly, helpful staff? Free WiFi? Good location? This downtown Chicago hotel has all that and more. Sure, it's getting a bit shabby around the edges, but the staff are making sure guests are getting the most they can offer. We took a 5-day excursion to Chicago to see the sights of the city, not spend our days in a hotel room, and the Red Roof was situated within walking distance of about half of our destinations and one short block off the Magnificent Mile, making connecting to the CTA buses, subways and el-trains easy. Even though we booked through a discount online service to get the cheapest rate we could, we were greeted as old friends, though we'd never been there before, given a room upgrade with a magnificent view, and found a welcome bag of goodies awaiting us. The staff made excellent dining recommendations, gave us tips negotiate the transit system and the hotel let us stash our bags for 10 hours after checkout. Of course, in 5 days, we didn't get to see everything Chicago has to offer, so we're definitely staying at this hotel on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “a very reasonable hotel right in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Sean C
Reviews.Content: This is this second time i have stayed here and nothing has changed in 5 years it has just dated It is time for an upgrade but still good value and clean,we arrived at 1 in the morning and the desk staff were great we had just flown 22 hrs and were exhausted they wervery friendly and got us to our room very promptly Had a bit of trouble opening the windows to get fresh air but once we got that done sleep like a baby until early morning andthen we went exploring chicago and what a great city I Love it Do the river architecture tour it is a must for visitors to chicago to understandthecity.

Reviews.Title: “VIP Treatment without the VIP Prices”
Reviews.Author: midwestsunshine74
Reviews.Content: As a former customer service trainer, I'm always observing customer experiences. The Downtown Chicago Red Roof definitely earns an A+! Since I started my current job a year ago, I'm back and forth to Chicago often. We stay at the Downtown Red Roof for the value and the proximity to our office. The staff has always been extremely friendly and accommodating, and they always knew my boss by name, which was nice, but expected seeing that she stays there sometimes 3 weeks out if a month or more. The rooms are always clean, the beds always comfy. It was my last visit which blew me away. I had not been to Chicago for probably 3 months. Even when I came regularly, unlike my boss, I was only there maybe once a month. When I checked in, I wasn't surprised that they greeted me as if they were really happy to see me. I wasn't even surprised that despite the hundreds and hundreds of people who are in and out of the busy hotel, they recognized my face. What shocked me was as I reached in my purse to get my ID, the clerk addressed me by name. She knew what kind of room I liked. She even knew to use my Redi Card and corporate code to get me the best rate...all without me saying a word. I felt like a celebrity. In addition to the five-star customer service, the hotel provides the most affordable and covenient valet parking in downtown Chicago. They offer free bag checking for those who arrive before check-in or business travellers like me who need a place to stash their luggage after check-out while they conduct their business in the city. There are great restaurants just steps away, and the hotel is just a block from the Magnificent Mile. When I'm at the Red Roof in Downtown Chicago, I feel like I'm in a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “A dump”
Reviews.Author: TeresaAnd
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is in a good downtown location, but the rooms are tiny, depressing, and less than clean. If it hadn't been 11:00 PM, and if our car hadn't already been taken away by the valet, we would have walked out. We did request (and get) a less smoky smelling room which helped somewhat. We decided to make the best of things; however, when we got our bill for over $400 for 2 nights, I got mad all over again, especially about the bogus $1.50/day 'safe fee.' The staff were helpful, and I don't blame them for the shabbiness of the hotel, but the Red Roof Inn chain should be ashamed. This has turned me off ever staying at a RRI again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: vemol
Reviews.Content: Relation price/quality terrible. Small room with very bad odor. In general the hotel needs a quick renovation

Reviews.Title: “Depressing room with ants, GREAT location!!”
Reviews.Author: sphess
Reviews.Content: I always look for the best bargain and location and am not picky, but we found the room to be very depressing and outdated. The wall paper had a panel feel with dark redish carpet. The pictures people have posted give a good view of what they looked like. When we found sugar ants marching a piece of popcorn around the room right after check-in I asked for a different room, maybe newer? However, they said we WERE in the new section. They did let me "borrow" their vacuum so I could vacuum them up. We continued to have ants through the 5 day stay and I continued to borrow the vacuum each night. The staff was pleasant and I was told I would get a $30 credit on my hotel fee for the inconvenience, but I never saw it. But for the time we spent in the room, if you don't mind the depressing feel and maybe a few ants - it was a GREAT LOCATION AT A GREAT PRICE! It is right around the corner from the Magnificent Mile, go to the delicious popcorn store across the street (but remember don't drop a piece in your room)! : )

Reviews.Title: “Great location and cheap price, no bells and whistles though”
Reviews.Author: jazvrx
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is the main reason i picked it and it didn't let me down, it is right in the middle of everything and is still quiet, there is a hospital on the next block so sometimes i did hear the sirens but they weren't much of a hassle at all. The price i paid was also fair for what i got, would stay here again and would recommend to others, it has no bells and whistles, it is a bed, tv, bathroom, Im not one to go and pay big money on hotels, yet i still like to have clean and safe, i felt that here. (make sure that when checking out, if you didn't use the safe in the room, you let them know and they gave you back the cost they charge for the safe, which is about $1.50 a day. The room smelt weird, which ended up on my clothes wasn't pleasant, but i got over it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: whit4brains
Reviews.Content: I went to the Red Roof Inn with pretty low expectations, but my budget didn't allow for anything else. I was pleasantly surprised by the great location and friendly staff. The room was simple but adequate - and let me say again how pleased I was with the location. I was able to get around much of downtown by foot and even caught the metro back to the airport, so only used one brief taxi and no car rentals. Ashur greeted me at the door each time I came and went and was more than happy to help with luggage and whatever else he could. Michael at the front desk was friendly and efficient, going the extra mile as well. For a single, simple traveler just looking for a safe place at a great location, Red Roof is a pretty good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Experience lower than my lowest expectations”
Reviews.Author: sonnywaheed
Reviews.Content: Having never been to a Red Roof Inn before, I expected something along the line of the UKs Travelodge or Premier Inn chain - a simply appointed room with the basic amenities anyone would need. And to be fair, I got that. Except, unlike travelodge/Premiere Inn, this place was scruffy, smelly, dated and, in parts, downright dirty. The coridoors were dimly lit with faded wallpaper and very old carpeting. The lifts were slow and noisy. the rooms fared no better. There was very limited lighting (which was a godsend, as it hid the horror of the awaiting room). All the interior design elements (wallpaper, carpets, bed linen, desks etc.) were old and looked dirty. Wallpaper was peeling off the walls, skirting boards were coming away from the walls, carperts were dusty in parts and threadbare in others. The bathroom was small and, again, just looked dirty. The rooms were poor at keeping noise out; so you could hear doors opening and closing along the corridor and any conversations there could be easily heard. On the plus side, the mattress was comfortable - but it too was dirty having seen the side of the mattress on exiting the bathroom, I could see stains imprinted onto it. There's no denying that it's in a great location, but no commercially available accomodation in any civilised country should be available legally.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: caaatrin
Reviews.Content: Our first allocated room 1616 was awful. It stank and the air con machine sounded like a large truck or tractor, and found bits of food all over the carpet. We went streight down in the very slow lift to ask if it was possible to change rooms, to find that many of our party of 48 were complaining too! One of the party even found a trail of ants in the bed....! We were allocated room 1615, which was much better, although it could have done with some vacuming, and the towels were stained. The beds were clean, and the air con ran quietly so we were greatful that we weren't sleeping with ants. Reception staff confronted us whilst checking out, claiming that we hadn't paid (we were part of a pre paid group booking) and this made us feel very uncomfertable, although the issue was soon dealt with. Red Roof Inn has a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: Lyn49006
Reviews.Content: Room was small, nothing fancy and no frills (newspaper, breakfast etc). But this is what we prefer. I do not like to pay hundreds of dollars for a bed or a room that I spend very little time in. There was wi-fi in the room which worked well. Service was prompt and friendly. Elevators small and slow. Price for Chicago was excellent. The selling point here is the location. It is a block off of Michigan Ave (The Magnificent Mile) and about 3 blocks north of the river so convenient if you want to go shopping, or head south to the museums. Felt perfectly safe here. An added bonus was the small Italian cafe (Coco Pazzo Cafe) below and around the corner on St. Clair St. It was excellent and convenient, especially the night it rained and we didn't want to walk someplace else. If you are a light sleeper you may find the ambulance noise a problem. The Northwestern Hospital ER is less than a block away and the ambulances will have their sirens blaring until they turn the corner at the north end of the block. This did not bother us, but our friends who's room was on the northern most corner of the hotel, albeit on the 9th floor, found it annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean room.”
Reviews.Author: JMac M
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about staying here after reading some of the reviews, however the hotel was priced competively and the location was perfect (one block from Michigan Avenue "Magnificent Mile"). The check in process was handled in a friendly and efficient manner by Kelly. Kelly was also helpful when I went to book some tickets for a cruise along the Chicago River. The room was clean and had everything that we required and requested on our booking. Our beds were comfortable and the wireless internet worked but did slow down in peak times. Whilst the hotel is looking a little tired, it would probably take very little to change this. Would definitely return next time I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: scutr2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect spot 1/2 a block off the magnifiecent mile, while it is not 5 star it was sufficent for our needs. Yes the room was a small room but we didn't spend much time there with so much to do outside. If you are looking for luxury with all the bells and whistles this is not it. If you are looking for a clean place to lay your head after a busy day of sightseeing and shopping then this will work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: budgetqueen
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old nephew has been after me for over a year to go to Chicago. :) So, this was our first trip. I used Trip Advisor, but was looking for a low cost, central hotel option. The Red Roof Inn, fit the bill perfectly. The location couldn't be beat for our touring, which included the Air and Water Show. It was a block away from Michigan Ave buses, easy access to to the El's, and a great walking location. Plenty of food options nearby, including Pizza Uno, Pizza Due, and Pizza Gino's of which we tried all three. :) The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms, basic, kept very clean were fine for us. If you require "more" for a room, then another choice would probably suit you better. But if you seek, an excellent location, reasonable rates, in a safe, full service area, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Southlandrover
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here and thoroughly enjoyed the comfort and amenities provided. Very modest tariffs, very affordable. All mod cons provided in the rooms and sleeping arrangements quiet and cozy. Extremely close to shopping and food places. Woould highly recommend both for couples and family.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff ever!!”
Reviews.Author: valvolinescott
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good location... Walking distance to Rush Street, Millenium Park, etc. Hotel is a little older but clean and everyone on the staff was very friendly and accomodating!

Reviews.Title: “Be warned...you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: KelliD_11
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was a good price and location for a little weekend trip for our family to Chicago. I was somewhat prepared for the conditions of this hotel, but it was still a bummer when we checked in. Very old hotel. Our room was very small with no closet, no hangers and nowhere to put our suitcase. There were only 3 of us in our room and we were ontop of each the entire time. It was very dirty feeling, dark and old. The beds and the bedding were old, the carpet was gross (there were even old potato chips on the floor!) and bathroom smelled like sewage. We had a coffee pot, but no place to plug it in. My sister n laws room was the same way and the hair dryer didnt work in their bathroom. Also, she asked the front desk 2 different times for extra pillows and she even offered to go down to the lobby to get them at one point...but no one ever got them for her. Without a doubt, I will spend the extra money to stay in a nicer hotel when we return to Chicago. It was such a downer that we actually dreaded going back to the hotel at the end of the day. The only good thing....we were busy site seeing and we didnt have to spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Safe place and confortable”
Reviews.Author: tarla_10
Reviews.Content: I like tosay each time I come to visit Lansing I always stay at Lansing, IL Red Roof Inn. I can count on it to be clean and the staff is always very nice and goes the extra mile for you if need be. If Ii asked for something they always assited.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: lrpulini
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most pleasant hotel epxceriences I have had in a long time. I tried not to listen to the naysayers who posted negative reviews here. I was in Chicago for the first time and travelling solo. From the moment I walked in, i was treated like a VIP. Wonderful Kelly at the front desk informed me that since I was a Redicard member, I received a complimentary upgrade to a suite. I was so excited to hear this news!!! I had two lovely rooms, 11/2 baths and great amenities. I had a nice view from a high floor and my room was peaceful and serene. The room was always neat and clean and well stocked. Everyone was pleasant and friendly at the front desk anytime I needed help. I loved the location and really enjoyed my long weekend in Chicagoland courtesy of the RRI. Thanks again everyone for really making me feel "at home".

Reviews.Title: “Ok I guess”
Reviews.Author: MrsYerk
Reviews.Content: I would say I didn't have my hopes real high in the first place because of the cost in comparison to other hotels in the area. We probably got what we paid for, but we'll pay the extra in the future and stay somewhere nicer. Rooms were quite small, but I know that's pretty much the norm in Chicago so we aren't complaining about that. Elevators were unbelievably slow!!!! We waited for over 10 min. the one time. Now we are fit people and normally would have just taken the stairs rather than wait, but with several large bags it wasn't an option to carry them to the 7th floor. Our phone didn't work in our room, and hot water was in short supply. I was up early on the morning of check out and had it turned as high as it would go and it wasn't even luke warm. My only other complaint if the didn't have enough front desk help to handle the people checking in and out on Sunday morning, it was insane. Valet is pretty pricey as well, higher than we paid when staying at the Hard Rock and that hotel is amazing in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome CUSTOMER SRVC... badly deteriorating hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ivegotvacationfever
Reviews.Content: Traveling was me, my husband and two teenage sons. I have friends who had stayed at this hotel many times and only spoke good things about it. I had myself recommended it to friends just on the basis of my friends good praises. Boy were they wrong. Serious water issue going on at this hotel. It smelled horrific. Damp. Dirty dog/towel smell to it. Horrible. Water damaged drywall in the hallways. Water in the stairwells making using the stairs dangerous. Using the stairs is necessary with how slow and small the elevators are. We had to switch rooms because our first room was disgusting and dirty. 2nd room not that much better. I had heard that the hotel was renovated a few years ago. The ONLY signs or renovation was the carpeting in the hallways and the lobby. The rooms were OUTDATED. Stained carpeting... peeling wallpaper... lamps that don't work... dirty bathrooms (visible signs of dirt)... old ugly comforters... and don't get me started on the beds. Those should have been replaced YEARS AGO. The noise level was horrendous. You want to hear whats going on with someone else in the hotel? Just go into your bathroom and you can hear everything through the vents! It was so loud we had to shut our bathroom door just so we could sleep! This hotel is in a GREAT LOCATION... it just needs to be updated and restored. It is old, dirty and not good. I will say though that the CUSTOMER SERVICE is fantastic! They were more than happy to switch our rooms. They were more than happy to help us. Service at check in/out was quick/efficient and friendly. I hope for the sake of this hotel they clean things up soon.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: esladky
Reviews.Content: The Red Roof had a good location to a lot of attractions. While I understand this commanded a high price for the rooms, I still don't feel the atmosphere was worth $400 for a weekend. Next time I'm in Chicago or any big city, I would recommend splurging for a higher-end hotel. It can't be that much more expensive!

Reviews.Title: “I am normally easy to please -- worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Fatoldsun999
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago on business in July of 2011. I selected this hotel due to its location next to Northwestern University's downtown campus. The hotel is old, dirty and musty. I was forced to move rooms because the safe began randomly opening and closing preventing sleep. The room I was moved to was so small there was not room between the bed and the wall to do push ups (there is no gym). The free wireless worked around 10% of the time. In 5 nights, my rooms were not cleaned 2 of those nights. One night there was a man banging on doors, screaming and cursing in the hallway at 4am. It took hotel staff over a half an hour to deal with the situation. I was alone, but would never return with my wife or family. I did not feel safe at this hotel. My advice is to spend a little more and get a safe clean downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: tlc250b
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned about staying here after reading some of the reviews. We were looking for an affordable hotel in a good location and Red Roof was just the thing. The elevators are a bit small but served their purpose. Our room was clean and odor-free. The staff from the car attendants outside who parked our car to the staff at the desk to check us in were all very polite and courteous. They were all quick to help and answer all our questions. The bathrooms were spotless. There was even an extra pillow in the dresser which was a welcome surprise. Check-out was quick and easy and the staff even thanked us for staying with them and asked if our stay was pleasant. The air conditioners worked fabulous-better than at other hotels that cost more money. And I didn't see a single bug anywhere in the hotel! If you're expecting the Hilton you should probably just stay at the Hilton. This was a great hotel that met my expectations. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but cold and dirty.”
Reviews.Author: squidgybo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of an Archers tour (route 66). The rooms were quite tired and shabby. My wifes parents room had no heating whatsoever, so they were put in a different room which had cockroaches in the next morning when they awoke. When we got down to the lobby, there was a queue of people from our tour lining up to complain to the tour director about their rooms. Recommend the Corner bakery cafe for breakfast-just 100 yards up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do it”
Reviews.Author: deerjeff
Reviews.Content: A less expensive room for the city, in a nice location, great staff, thats where it end. Needs some serious soap and updating. The paint was peeling off the doors in sheets, bugs in the bathtub., enough said.

Reviews.Title: “A LITTLE CONCERNED AFTER READING NEGATIVE REVIEWS”
Reviews.Author: JOHN H
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive after reading several negative reviews of the hotel. I took the time to skim "all" reviews and like movie reviews, hotel reviews are as much of an extension of the reviewer's personality as it is a description of the hotel. Many of the negative reviews were somewhat accurate: it wasn't the newest hotel that I've stayed; the elevators were indeed "small". These "negative" reviews actually helped temper by expectations. We (wife and I) were in Chicago for a convention, not a honeymoon, an exotic vacation or an important date in my life. We were only at the hotel to sleep. Our room did not smell like chlorine, the carpet was new by any stretch, but we were not concerned walking bare foot. We had free wifi (yeah), it was two blocks to our shuttle bus to the convention, the valet were prompt... So the big question, would I recommend the hotel, YES... with the understanding that it's not the Hilton... or a Holiday Inn Express... but it served it's purpose. Please note, I'm saying this even though I stayed the night in a much better hotel one block away. My greatest beef was the room rate. The nicer hotel one block away was about $20 bucks per night cheaper. If a room were available the night before, I would have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Route66”
Reviews.Author: Janep18
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location but the rooms let it down badly . They were clean but the corridors and room had an unpleasant smell and we could t open windows . Serious upgrade needed . However staff were helpful and friendly . I didn't t realise that the red roof hotels were such a large chain through the u s a , others we saw while travelling looked much smarter

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Jlie56
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel near Michigan avenue shopping that was reasonably priced. We had the room reserved at the rate of 184 a night. It was not worth 50. It was tiny, dirty, old and the service from the staff at the front desk was atrocious. The air conditioning broke and after the room hit 82 degrees we complained and got out of the room. Bottom line do NOT go here.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING do NOT stay at this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: billyBang
Reviews.Content: A week from Hell; Day 1. â€œGreetedâ€� by a most unwelcoming receptionist. Room tiny, worn, and despite stinking of bleach was filthy. After 5 minutes the toilet started itâ€™s automatic flush cycle which went on for at least an hour before I begrudgingly had my room changed â€“ a little bigger but equally dirty. Day2. Key failed to open door had to go down to the desk where I was again made to feel like a nuisance. Day3. Awoke to find a cockroach the size of a small mouse on the pillow beside my head (at this point I had made up my mind to checkout, but due to a big conference in town for the week there wasnâ€™t a free be to had in the city). Day 4. Returned to my room at 11 pm to find that the fire alarm was beeping (needing a new battery) after several phone calls and a couple of comical room visits the problem was eventually fixed (by ripping the alarm off the wall) at 12.45 am. Day5. Last night thank God! housekeeping called at 5.30pm to â€˜doâ€™ my room â€“ as I was shaving at the time I asked her to call back in 5 minutes â€“ she didnâ€™t. Not that it mattered much as my sheets were not changed once during my stay. Also, on arrival, 10 dollars was charged to my credit card for â€˜incidentalsâ€™ â€“ as of a week later this has not been refunded!! This place should be closed down!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location ok rooms but needs serious makeover”
Reviews.Author: quearaba
Reviews.Content: The room was fine for me and my friend (2 people) ..the house keeping came everyday i walked on her once she cleaned the toilet/ bathroom made the bed came everyday at 11ish (typical house keeping stuff) umm great location nice staff..no bugs in the room, exept ants in the elevator..we really only used the room for sleep, and taking shower..The only problems was there was dried up nasty blood stains on the carpet and on the chair's they look old and gross, also like lots of dust like in the conors of the room so i walked around with flip flops on and the matress was uncomftable the view was of the other hotel... but overall great vaule ok room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel. Awful mattresses.”
Reviews.Author: pinkcess
Reviews.Content: Best deal for Memorial Day weekend considering the location. The hotel (more like motel) was alright. Nothing spectacular and nothing horrible. The beds were the worst part. All the mattresses I saw in the rooms were sagging and unstructured. Even the chairs in the front lobby were mashed. The carpet was really groody too. Felt like you couldn't walk around in bare feet. There was no fan in the bathroom and the water pressure was so low, you were better off standing in the pouring rain. The water pressure decreased ten-fold based on how hot you wanted your shower to be. Elevator was super slow and the cleaning staff always tried to get in to the elevator with you with their large carts and what not forcing you to get pushed in to the corner uncomfortably.

Reviews.Title: “YIKES!”
Reviews.Author: Nickee323
Reviews.Content: The staff at the reception couldn't be bothered to welcome the guests. Then came the journey up to our room on an old, beat-up elevator! It was so dirty that we huddled in the middle of it to avoid rubbing our clothes on the walls. The corridors were dull and musty. The first thing that hit us when we opened the room was the smell. It smelt of bleach everywhere! I could go on and on and HEIDI CORDES could reply kindly ti this e-mail. We already know that she'll all words and no action! It's sad. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “You have to be kidding me”
Reviews.Author: Cgvacation
Reviews.Content: This place is a glorified shooting gallery/hot sheet motel. The fact that reviews cite the location as a saving grace is preposterous. We were checked into a room with an unmade bed, the ironing board out in the middle of the room, trash in the garbage including a condom wrapper...etc. The decor is barely maintained. When my wife and I went immediately backdown to the desk, the clerk said "you're checking out right?", as though she knew . If you want to stay in a dump that's close to attractions, more power to you. I also find it somewhat suspect that negative reviews on here are always commented on by Heidi the"general manager" while the conditions remain third world. Maybe the priorities should be fixing the red roof...

Reviews.Title: “Our family had a great time on our trip to Chicago and we enjoyed the hotel that we chose.”
Reviews.Author: Js1577
Reviews.Content: We came to Chicago as a family trip..We chose to stay at the Red Roof in because of the excellent location. Walking distance to many places we were going, the parks.. the Pier and Mag Mile shopping. We really enjoyed our trip and we had a newly remodeled room. My husband and I had our privacy in our bedroom and bath and the kids also had seperate room with a bathroom, both with flat screen tv's also we had with a mini frige and a mic.. This was perfect for warming up Chicago pizza or keeping our cheesecake cool or some drinks or snacks for the kids...The price on this room was less money than any other hotel we have visited in downtown Chicago.. which gave us more spending money..I love that.. We had a great time at this place and we would return to this hotel.. Prior to our stay the manager and her staff trully helped me alot when I asked them about my concerns.. i had many with so much negative on the internet reviews.. They were really nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it...”
Reviews.Author: humpday
Reviews.Content: This place was horrendous. When I arrived, there was dries toothpaste spit in the sink. The hallways were loud. The lone computer used to print boarding passes wasn't working. The rooms look like they're falling apart. Go someplace else. Trust me...you'll save yourself a night of misery.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty!!!”
Reviews.Author: redd1576
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel that has not been kept up. It is dirty. Our bathroom had grime on every surface and the toilet had dirt streak marks from not being scrubbed clean. The floors were sticky! It smelled like bleach so I would assume the cleaning consisted of everything being wiped with a cloth with bleach on it. The beds are so old that you can see the springs in them and the heating units on the walls are in total disrepair. The blanket on our bed had cigarette burns and the linens (if you want to call them that) didn't smell clean and were not changed in the three days we stayed there. There must still be smoking rooms available because the smoke filtered into our room. The bathroom either smelled like bleach or smoke. Definietly don't stay here if you have kids because every time we stepped off the elevator (which broke and someone got stuck in for 10 minutes) it reaked of marijuana. There are definitely better places to stay within the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Nice Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Largoj
Reviews.Content: Okay yes the hotel could use some work. The bathrooms are kinda gross, lobby small, etc...However the location and the Staff are wonderful. I have never had a problem here. Very happy the internet is working.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, economical, friendly, professional and courteous”
Reviews.Author: jokash
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a basic limited-frills place where one can stay closeby to most attractions for an affordable price and then spend money elsewhere. Staff are friendly and courteous and helpful in solving problems. There has been recent renovation to some of the rooms, with small refrigerator, coffee machine, safe in room. Wireless access in rooms is convenient. Can be a bit noisy due to location and hall noise by guests, but with earplugs is manageable. I am a repeat customer and plan to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value with minor compomises”
Reviews.Author: albertncbs
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with a great shopping in the vicinity. The rooms are quite good and though I had a problem with my first room (the toilet flush jammed and flooded the bathroom) - the front office promptly changed my room . The lifts could do with a 'face-lift' but the front office were very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and run down, but good location!!”
Reviews.Author: teach3876
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was not very good at all. The rooms was cold iwth very little heat they never fixed and then gave us smally blankets to keep warm with. There was blak mold behind the toilet and tons of hair in the drain. A drawer was duct taped on. It had not been vaccumed good in months, there was a thick dust around all the carpet/wall edges. The service people working there could care less. They said what do you expect from a run down place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: Keinika
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple got some rooms here for New Year's Eve. The room is small but it was ok. There were hairs on our sheets but we running late for dinner so we didn't have time to call the front desk. The bathroom is really small, with a high tub, and it smelt like someone had just used it. Surpringsly it was quiet and the bed was comforatable. There was an issue with some wrong charges on my card. This charged made our account overdraw. The hotel management kept insisting that my bank charged me and not them, which any reasonable person knows is impossible. After me having to call my bank, they sent a letter to my bank to have the charged removed. It seemed like it took them forever because my ride ended up having to leave and I had to get my husband to come back and pick me up. They did the letter and the amounts were incorrect so they had to redo it. It was finally right. Then 3 days later there was another charge that was valid that they failed to inform me about. I asked if they would do anything or my incovience and they in so many words said no. It wasn't until I emailed their Guest Relations department that they sent me a free night. So everything worked out, just slowly. Its the cheapest place close to the Mag Mile, so if thats what you want then go for it. If not, pay the extra $20 and go around the corner to the Inn of Chicago, way better!

Reviews.Title: “Reserved a room during their $20/ night Jan. 2nd promo. $20 is $20 too much.”
Reviews.Author: trav312
Reviews.Content: This was, hands down, the grossest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Or have ever NOT stayed in, I guess I should say, because we didn't stay overnight. Back in December, Red Roof Inn ran a promo where it was $20. and change to stay one night (January 2nd) at any of their US locations. Since we live outside of Chicago, I thought this would be something fun for my husband & I to do. $20 hotel, great location, what's to lose? Normally I research hotels to death before booking, but I could *swear* I'd stayed at this exact hotel years ago, so I didn't research this at all. Big mistake, because I stayed at the hotel across the street, not the Red Roof Inn! This hotel's location is fantastic: 1/2 block off Michigan Ave., 8 blocks from Navy Pier, close to tons of restaurants. It's a perfect location for Chicago shopping/touring. It is safe & very "walkable." Upon check in, the employee looked absolutely startled to see us, perhaps because I am not a hooker? I do not know. In hindsight, I should have known right then that this was a mistake. He was very, very nice. Check in was quick, the rate was correct, we were in our room in minutes. The room was so outdated- like nothing I'd ever seen before. Seriously, my retro 1970's cottage is more 'up to date' than this hotel. The room was small, which I can handle. It was a bed, a dresser with a flat screen tv and a desk. The walls were dingy. I could literally see through the sheets. The sheets were stained. The carpeting was disgusting- like keep your shoes on disgusting, because the Red Roof Chicago apparently doesn't include vacuuming with their cleaning service. There was so much lint/ crumbs/ random debris along where the carpet met the walls, I nearly gagged. We reserved a smoking room, so anticipated a smoky smell, again something I can handle. However, there were ashes all over the desk, floor and bed. My husband had to use the washroom and didn't even wash his hands afterwards because he didn't want to touch the faucet! I would recommend staying anywhere else but here, even if it means buying less while shopping, it's that bad. Remember, this was a $20 room that I wouldn't spend $20 on! I have no idea what the regular rate is, but there is no way I would pay money to stay here. We immediately checked out & were told that we wouldn't be charged. I would have happily paid $20 NOT to stay in this hotel, so I couldn't care less. All in all this ended up being 19 minutes of my life & $6 for 19 minutes of parking that I am ok losing. We ended up going home & having dinner locally, lol. Would I recommend this to a friend? I wouldn't recommend this hotel to someone I dislike, let alone someone I might see again!

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't pay me to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: alissaulm
Reviews.Content: When reading reviews on hotels (which I do often when booking hotels) I always think the bad reviews here and there could just be people being a little too harsh. Bc I've seen bad reviews on Great places to stay. You can't please everybody, ya know! Well, no... this is not the case on the Redroof Inn. My boyfriend & I are Very easy going & easily please and this hotel was just TERRIBLE! Outdated, old, and just filthy! Honestly, we didn't even want to sleep under the covers!! I've stayed at many places in Chicago, and for the price, this hotel is Not Worth It! I wouldn't even stay there again if they gave me a room for free. The whole hotel needs updating. There was no microwave or fridge in our room as claimed. And there wasn't Any Amenities. Nothing! The downstairs of this hotel only consist of the front desk & sitting area. There isn't even a common area to heat up food or anything. On top of it all, we kept having staff knock on our doors to see if someone was in the room. Not just once, or twice, but three times it happened. And early early in the morning! I don't know about you, but when I'm on vacation I like my privacy and that was not the case at this dive. The only plus side to this hotel is it's wonderful location. But I don't think even the location would make it worth the stay. This whole hotel needs a makeover, Bad!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cheap hotel near the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: smilix
Reviews.Content: For everyone who wants to go shopping a perfect location - just around the corner of Michigan Avenue. Pricewise it's just perfect and for the money you pay it's really ok. The hotel needs some renovation, but it's tidy. The rooms are very small. You should go for a room with twin beds, what I had, so you have some extra space :-) The staff was very friendly and helpful. Free-Wifi in the room...

Reviews.Title: “ROOM OVERBOOKED & ITEMS TAKEN OUT OF SUITCASE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: InTheCity2010
Reviews.Content: Our room was overbooked by a creep!! The hotel overbooked our room and this man went through all of our suitcases and stole several items. He called us asking us to meet him to get our things back. The hotel didn't know they overbooked the room until we called to ask if they had seen any suspicious activity. They moved the man to a different room and he wasn't kicked out for stealing our things!! Service was absolutely terrible - I would recommend the Inn of Chicago if you want to stay near this area. THE WORST EXPERIENCE EVER & I TRAVEL A LOT!!!!!!!!! I will never stay at a Red Roof INN again â€“ and neither will any of my friends, family or co-workers

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Vcllist
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to have a corner room on the top floor, so we had lots of windows and a nice view. It wasn't the fanciest place- carpets and beds were old obviously, but the bathroom was small but clean and the room was fine for a budget place. I was worried by some of the reviews, but we enjoyed our stay. The location is great- only one block off Michigan Ave. Super convenient for walking to explore the city. Staff was nice, especially doormen and valet parking guys- they were friendly and gave us tips on restaurants. In short, I'd stay here again, especially considering the affordability factor. You do have to pay extra for parking, and it is valet only, but that's typical of places in large cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Chicago from”
Reviews.Author: sichuanhotpot
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel for its location. I stayed for 7 nights and was a great spot from which everything thats great about Chicago is easy to access. Walking distance to the Magnificent Mile shopping, lots of places to eat, Pizzera Uno & Quattrros were a 5 - 10 minute walk and Garretts popcorn is basically across the road. Rooms where small, bathroom was very small however we were hardly in the room so I am never fussed about that when I travel. Beds where made each day and clean towels where provided, staff where helpful with directions, providing bowls and cutlery when we ate in one night - really can't complain. Would stay again if visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for Girl Friends Week-end”
Reviews.Author: Mexican Rose
Reviews.Content: Eight of us stayed at this hotel in September for a Girls Week-End in Chicago. Location was great as we wanted to stay close to Michigan Avenue. Valet service and front desk service was great. Check in went very smoothly also. Our room were adequate for the short period of time that we were in them. For the dollars that we spent it definitely was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “this place is pretty good”
Reviews.Author: chrisbohne1
Reviews.Content: it was clean having nearby ice and soda machine made it better only thing that wasn't so great was the air conditioning was stuffy and warm in the room,

Reviews.Title: “STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!”
Reviews.Author: DanaPaul
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled through Chicago, IL on business. We decided to stay a night in Chicago as I had never been there and had always wanted to see the city. We booked this hotel over the phone from downtown Chicago. When we pulled up, a very nice valet came and took our vehicle. The lobby was very small and the people at the front desk were pleasant. We were given a room right away. The room was not very big, not very clean and looked as if it hadn't been updated since Al Capone was alive! The internet was slow and, in fact, my husband had to call a 1 800 # to get internet service! The bathroom was tiny and the hotel had a smell that was a cross between roadkill and a burnt tuna cassarole. Next time, we will plan/reserve ahead. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Book early for best value in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: NC1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older for sure, small rooms, darkish hallways, so-so lobby. But really how much time do you plan to spend there? If you want to get an incredible value just a stone's throw away from the Miracle Mile, book early and you'll be shocked at how low the rate is. The gals behind the counter are super nice and helpful. I didn't hear any other guest noise. Plenty of in-room coffee. Pantene (!) products in bathroom. And to top it all off, there's a Trader Joe's right down Ontario. This is great for handy snacks and lunchy foods without the eat-out price. This hotel is right near the Mus of Contemp Art as well as the old water works and tower. Do something different and go to the LUMA on free Tuesdays. Catch the 146 down Miracle Mile direct to the Field, etc. The only drawback to this hotel is being close to Northwestern's hospital means you'll be hearing ambulances at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, sufficient amenities”
Reviews.Author: pashadarby
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect. It was walking distance to the Magnificent Mile (Coach and Ann Taylor on same block). The rooms were sufficient. Nothing to 'wow' over but clean and sufficient. Front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Does location beat cleaniless?”
Reviews.Author: jayceetraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Red Roof Inn the Oct. 22 weekend. I last stayed at this hotel in 2007 and considered it a budget option for future trips. Based on my weekend experience, it's off my list. The hotel is in an excellent location - on Ontario St. one block off Michigan Avenue. However, the wear and tear on the hotel is very apparent: Rugs are dingy, bedspreads are long past their prime, and the rooms are extremely small. We had a tiny bathroom with no exhaust, and there's just one mirror in room, in the bathroom (when there are more than 2 women in a room, this quickly becomes an issue! LOL). We asked for adjoining rooms, didn't get them, not sure it's even an option. Our first non-smoking room wasn't, so we had to be transferred to another. Very slow elevators. I killed a centipede in the lobby! No complimentary coffee in lobby. There are plenty of other hotels in this area, perhaps another $10 or $20/night, but well worth the extra money to get a few extras in service.

Reviews.Title: “You get a little less than you pay for”
Reviews.Author: timf99
Reviews.Content: There were a couple of problems. The smoke detector in my room was missing, with just a couple of dangling wires. I'm tempted to report this to the city of Chicago. The attitude of the front desk was very lax about entry to the building. With the elevators so close to the main entrance, no one seemed be paying much attention to who comes and goes. The front door to my room had to be pulled firmly before it would lock. I didn't feel very safe. The policy of charging $1.50 a day for use of the in-room safe unless one asks the charge to be removed at checkout is very tacky and doesn't speak well of corporate attitude towards "guests." I understand the concept of "you get what you pay for," so I won't complain about the stained carpet, the cramped bathroom, the indifferent housekeeping, and other indignities. I am however, grateful there were no bedbugs. I appreciate the bargain rate, but I would have to be pretty desperate before I stay at this hotel again again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: sealonsf
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and is by far the cheapest option for the area. It was adequate for our needs. The bathroom floor was a bit disgusting around the edges, but overall the room was clean. The a/c worked, and with the white noise it provided, it was easy to get a good night's sleep. The front staff were friendly. We did overhear some guests complaining about "hair in the bathroom" but really, it's a cheap place to stay in downtown Chicago. You can't expect the quality to match the other hotels in the area with prices many times what we paid per night. I would stay here again if in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Paying for spectacular location - not much else”
Reviews.Author: Trev-in-Milwaukee
Reviews.Content: A perfectly adequate hotel for exploring Chicago on foot or by public transit when you are not looking for anything else besides a place to crash. I have no idea why one would choose to stay in River North and sit around in a hotel room -- this is the most densely packed restaurant and shopping part of the city -- so why bother to pay for amenities you won't use. Free WiFi and one block off Michigan Ave in the heart of the Magnificent Mile. I would best describe the room as "well used". Things were clean (wallpaper peeled a bit about the radiator) and check-in/out quick. There was no parking on site, but they had $37 valet parking with in/out privileges. For reference, the closest public garage (right across the street) is $37 for 12-24 hours, so they are not gouging - this is just the facts about bringing a car to downtown Chicago. Given the location, you only want a car long enough to get you to the hotel. Park it and forget about it.

Reviews.Title: “CONVENIENT, AFFORDABLE AND FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: bstansberry
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay in Chicago. It has been several years since I have been there and don't plan on waiting too long before I return. Very friendly and helpful staff at the hotel. Hotel is located just a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue. This city is rich with history and just plain fun! I highly recommend just getting out there and taking in as many sites as your trip allows. Chicago has a great public transit system so you can travel anywhere with ease. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Clean , comfortable , central.”
Reviews.Author: chelseagirl50
Reviews.Content: Just such a shame some states still let people smoke indoors. As a Brit we are used to being able to smell clean air indoors now and it comes hard having to still put up with other people's filthy habits. Even so our room on the 15th floor was clean and comfortable and it's a really central hotel just off Michigan Avenue. We did ask for a towel change but never got one, but that's just a minor thing. If you are a non-smoker make sure you don't ask for the 9th floor!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: mkrupa
Reviews.Content: Recently, I did stay at this Red Roof Inn, during the Chicago IL, music festival. When I did arrive there, I was informed that there was no vacancy. So, I did go next door and had lunch, as well as a shake at the Baskin Robbins/Dunkun Doughnuts store. I also did notice that in the lobby that there was no coffee machine. I did ask the clerk, and he did tell me that they have it in the rooms. A short time atter that, I was checked in. When I did get to my room, I did notice that they had a plasma T.V. I did watch some tv, then went out for a walk to Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “WORST STAY EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: ajmic
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this INN three weeks in a row, and the price changes EVERY TIME i come here! Three weeks ago, I paid $55, two weeks ago, I paid $89, and this week I paid $75. They need to make a price and stick with it! Secondly... My family thinks this is the most convenient place to stay (it`s closest to where we need to be) and so I received a free loyalty room. When I got here, they charged me $20 for the room. When i made the reservations, NO ONE stated that over the phone, NO ONE mentioned that in the letter; I also wrote an e-mail to make sure that I wasn't paying anything for the room, and I was confirmed that it would be ABSOLUTELY FREE. so then WHY ARE THEY CHARGING ME $20?!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Money”
Reviews.Author: redpepper74
Reviews.Content: I have to say first of all... it's a Red Roof Inn, not the Hilton. If you don't go in with super high expectations you won't be disappointed. My husband and I stayed one night and paid $140. The room is super small, the hotel is old, the elevator is small, and the carpets could be replaced. Other than that, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the staff was nice, and the location and price can't be beat. If you want to have that "Oooooh!" moment when you walk in the door of your room, go someplace else and pay about $100 more. But if you want a basic place to sleep for a good price, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: aer2001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 2 nights with my friend for a girls weekend. The staff was always very friendly, and willing to answer any questions we had. The public areas of the hotel were clean, as was our room & bathroom. Housekeeping came later in the day, but cleaned up the room and made our beds. Our biggest complaint is the room & bathroom size. They're both extremely tiny! We both couldn't be in the bathroom at the same time, which isn't good when you're trying to get ready for a night out in the city. The location is perfect, being located only a few shorts blocks from Michigan Ave.!! Being 2 girls in the city, we always felt very safe anytime we'd leave or arrive at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if you can handle the fact that it's a VERY budget, no frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussievicgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed with one of my friends for a week at this hotel. We chose it due to the cost. Most of the hotels in and around this location are extremely expensive. In fact pretty much every hotel in Chicago is expensive. With the exception of staying a Youth Hostel, which we didn't want to do. If you want cheaper alternatives with hotels you have to stay outside of Chicago. This wasn't a viable option for us given we were going to rely on walking and using public transit and the occasional cab to get around and sight see. When we first arrived at the Red Roof Inn my instant thought was "I'm not going to like this". Unfortunately I was thinking this even more when we went up to our room on the 12th floor. The entire hotel needs some serious updating. From my perspective it looks far better from the outside than it does on the inside. Our room was small and relatively clean. However, it wasn't to the standard of other hotels we had stayed while in the United States. The bathrooms should be updated and there was a smell of mould on the shower curtain. The whole room/bathroom wasn't anything special at all. It certainly didn't look like it did on their website. The first impressions of this place weren't good ones, to the point of me wanting to go across the street to the Marriott, pay whatever they were asking and staying there for the week. However we decided to be brave and stick it out with the Red Roof Inn. We had a few problems. We couldn't get the fridge in the room to work and one of the lights over the bed was flickering on and off. The towel rack in the bathroom came off the wall as well. I reported these things to the front desk and they sent someone straight up. The issues were rectified, but not really to an appropriate standard. Never the less we were able to manage. It's not all negative feed back that I have to offer. What I will say about this hotel is if you can handle the fact that you would be staying in a totally NO FRILLS, BUDGET hotel and if you want somewhere that's central to all the shopping, sightseeing and within walking distance to downtown Chicago, Millenium Park and Navy Pier then this is the hotel for you. The location is one of the main factors that made me enjoy my stay at the Red Roof Inn. I found it extremely easy to walk around and sightsee. I really loved it. If you needed them, cabs were always readily available at the front door to the hotel and there was very easy access to the public transit systems, trains and buses. Which we found great to use. There are also plenty of great places to eat to suit all budgets and places like Walgreens, Traders Joes and 7/11 to purchase food items and other things you might need during your stay. There are some really great Irish pubs / bars within walking distance of this hotel as well. Plus you are within absolute minutes of all the fabulous shopping along the Magnificent Mile on Michigan Avenue, all the designer stores and Macy's, which is absolutely great. It's worth mentioning that the beds in our particular room were very comfortable, which was a blessing, especially when you are staying in a hotel for a week. Plus walking around every day. A comfortable bed to sleep in makes the world of difference. Our room was cleaned each day as well by a really nice staff member, this really helped make our stay a little more comfortable and easier. There was some degree of street noise, like sirens and things like that.. But lets face it MOST cities have that kind of noise. You can't expect to stay in a city and not have noise. I personally didn't find it a problem, others may do so. The main great experience we had staying at this particular hotel was the staff. Two in particular. Tammy at the front desk and one of the staff that cleaned our room. Tammy couldn't do more for us. She was great with offering advice on where to eat, how to use the public transit system and just information in general. She is a complete asset to the hotel. In fact she gave better service to us than some of the 4 and 5 star hotels we had already stayed in while in the United States. The fact our initial feelings about the hotel where "Oh My God, what are we doing here?". We ended up making the most of and enjoying our Red Roof Inn Chicago experience. The staff that we interacted with were a credit to the Red Roof Company and basically saved the day for us. Would I stay at this particular Red Roof Inn hotel while in Chicago again. I do have to be honest and say probably not, but that's basically just due to the actual hotel accommodation. However if my budget didn't allow for something that was located more downtown, then I would definitely stay at the Red Roof Inn again, I'd just probably pay the extra fee and stay in one of their Deluxe rooms. Just to have that extra space in the room would be worth it. I don't want to tell people not to stay here, but just to be aware that it's nothing overly special, so you don't get a shock if you do choose to stay at this hotel. My friend and I just made the most of it all. I totally loved Chicago and it far exceed any expectation that I had. It was my favorite part of my United States vacation. In fact I'm already planning to take my next vacation there. I know that this is a lengthy review, however I wanted to be as comprehensive and honest and I could be. I hope that my review helps anyone that is considering staying at the Red Roof Inn. Don't be scared to stay here, just be fully aware that it's a VERY BUDGET Hotel and remember it's fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Low Quality Hotel that charged for parking”
Reviews.Author: munseyp
Reviews.Content: Old hotel with dirty rooms was awoke at 6:00 am to banging and a drill from staff fixing something in the hallway. And with two young kids it made for a long day. Upon check out there was a misc. charge on my bill for 36.00 dollars when I asked what it was for they told me parking. Never heard of a hotel charge for parking. At check out I was never asked how my stay was.

Reviews.Title: “Cubs Game”
Reviews.Author: cbowden1
Reviews.Content: I overall was happy with the Hotel. My 13 year old son and I stayed 2 nights. My room was not turned over after the first night. The bathroom was very small and outdated.The soap dispenser was covered in mold on the underneath sides. We checked in quickly even though they were very busy. The staff was very helpfull and courteous. A little expensive for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: akabyam
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel, when I travel to Chicago, for nearly ten years now. The rooms are clean and in good repair, the price is unbeatable for a downtown Hotel and the location is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “very good location on downtown chicago at a very convenient price”
Reviews.Author: mariannaannairam
Reviews.Content: very good hotel for short stays. The room (two double beds) is not big, but well arranged. The staff is very nice and helpful. the hotel is one block from Michigan Ave (Magnificent Mile), just south of Northwestern Law and Medical School. Restaurants and boutiques nearby, 10 or 15 min walk to Navy Pier, Millenium Park, about 20min walk for the Loop. Nice walking area. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: garethturtle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 1 night and was lucky I only spent a short time in the room. The windows didn't open for health and safety reasons I'm sure, but it meant I couldn't air the room to get rid of the strange smell. I was also greeted with a drawing of a penis taped to the mirror in the bathroom which could have been put there by a disgruntled guest, just lucky for the Red Roof Inn that I found it amusing. The only possitive that I could get from this experience was how cheap it was and how polite all the staff I encountered were.

Reviews.Title: “affordable no frills”
Reviews.Author: AndrewTO
Reviews.Content: I spent the two previous night at the dump that is the Congress Plaza, over on Michigan. What a relief to come here. Yes, it's smaller etc, but it makes no pretence that it is anything other than what it is: affordable, clean, friendly, and central. If you aren't spending a lot of time in your room, it's perfect. But the bed was comfy, the shower etc working just fine, and so on. I got this for $50 on Priceline, and would pay the full price (about $95) if I had to. Compared to what you can get elsewhere in downtown Chicago, this place beats all the others hands down. Everyone knows Red Roof: you get what you pay for. And that's fine with me. But here I got even more. Bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: aquawaters
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel based on Frommer's star and recommendation for "your best bet for low-priced lodgings in Downtown Chicago". While the location and the service of the staff are great, the rooms are disgusting. I am a budget traveler and little things don't bother me, but these rooms are worse than budget third-world lodgings. The mattresses, pillows, sheets, curtains, and carpeting need to be thrown out and immediately replaced. They are old, damaged, stained, and uncomfortable. Literally this was the most depressing room I've been in. Your best bet for low-priced lodging - get on Priceline but don't stay here! We checked out 6 nights early.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is awesome! One could not ask...”
Reviews.Author: gopitt92
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome! One could not ask for a better value and location in downtown Chicago. Granted, it is in serious need of an update, the smell of mildew was noticible as we walked in our room and some of the furniture had rips,but overall, one can overlook those things.The staff was friendly and v ery helpfuln and again, location, location, location!! I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Below average facility, High risk of theft in front lobby”
Reviews.Author: KetMon
Reviews.Content: This is an old facility. Room and aisle size would remind you of your travel to Japan (narrow, small). Bathroom tub was slippery and bathroom had a strong musty smell (how it smells after water-leak/damage/mildew-mold damage?). Most of all, accidentally, we left a purse in front lobby (right across from front desk) just before midnight when checked in and forgot to take it to room. Next morning, we realized loss and called front desk, found it; however, all cash (about $80, four bills of $20s) was gone, but license and other cards were intact. Only a vallet service person was in small front lobby right across from sofa where we set (where it was left). Management was more keen to explain how hotel is not liable than to take any action feasible in their hands (i.e. inquire with vallet staff, janitor staff, front desk staff). We should have stayed at Comfort Inn or other for $20-$30 more than $95+tax+vallet etc. we paid here.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but very unclean!!”
Reviews.Author: Indiana-Storm-Boy
Reviews.Content: Our room was VERY dirty. The carpet had dirty lint buildup all around the edges like it hadn't been swept in years.
